review:
Bought the console. Was working fine for a week. Suddenly it stopped reading
discs. Now to the experience with the pathetic Microsoft service.  
The support from Microsoft is just pathetic, I don't get any replies to the
mails. Had to wait for 45 minutes and listen to the waiting tunes on the call
centre number and then got disconnected without having any conversation. Then
on the online chat which is half the time non functional, I somehow got
through to an agent who said he'd scheduled the return pickup. Then I waited
and waited, nothing came. Again went through the whole process to find out if
I'm lucky enough to contact the Xbox help centre, After a lot of attempts,
again somehow got through to an agent in the online chat. He said that the
previous agent missed out on scheduling the return label itself and he created
the same for me after making me wait for more than an hour. Then he was also
not sure about the process to follow through which I can send back the
product. He said he'll get back to me by eod, for which even after 48 hours
I'm waiting for. Even in doing the return schedule he committed a mistake, he
scheduled it as a refund, for which I got it corrected.. Then wrote to
Microsoft asking for the process, nothing came so far.  
Hence, I packed the Xbox console as given in the website and approached the
FedEx people, they refused to take in the parcel as the pickup is not
scheduled by Microsoft. This is really painful, If this is going to be the
experience for a person who buys an Xbox, I'm really really sorry... No wonder
Sony is the one which everyone's recommending. And I feel like being an idiot,
having taken this decision to buy an Xbox.  
The return label is created for 7 days, and I believe it expires today. And
today again I waited for half an hour listening to your waiting tunes just to
get disconnected and the online chat is always showing the status as closed.

Had some doubts upgrading to this from my ancient launch day XB1. This really
is a sleek machine. Brilliant industrial and contemporary design at the same
time. The white colour really pops amidst my all black entertainment unit. So
far really cool during gameplay  
And feels faster in just about everything. Love the small size and the
stormtrooper look.

It's been a good buying experience overall except for the fact that I am yet
to receive/hear about the other two games as promised along with the product,
so the ratings as seen

Though I own all the consoles. I must say ps4 still beats the Xbone. Ofcourse
I have a msi ge73vr 7rf laptop but we are comparing consoles here. Xbox one
has dynamic resolution scaling therefore graphics looks better in ps4 in
similar games.  
My advice buy Xbox one to enjoy exclusives like gears of war or quantum break,
but if u have pc then go for ps4.

The Xbox One S is a great console for a great price. It runs smoothly
supporting 4K as well as HDR gaming. Though if you already own the original
Xbox One, there is not much of a point to make the upgrade to the S.  
The Xbox One S is considerably smaller than the original Xbox One. In fact,
Microsoft states that it is 40% smaller than the original release. On top of
this, you don’t have to worry about the big external brick of a power supply,
because now it is built in straight to the console. This helps quite a bit
since the original power supply was basically as big as the console itself.  
As a gamer in advancing years, this is my first Xbox of any description and I
would like to give other young at heart gamer's a more balanced perspective
and help them overcome any techno fears that they may have. My previous
experience of modern games machines has been limited to the Wii which I
enjoyed very much but did have its limitations.  
PROS  
\- Plug and play. Ensure that your WiFi is on, connect the Xbox to the tv
using an HDMI lead, connect the power lead and put 2 x AA batteries into the
controller (I can recommend the rechargeable power packs available from
Amazon). Turn on the Xbox and it will guide you through the set up process.
You will need to set up a Microsoft account if you don't already have one.  
\- No need for a separate Blu-Ray/DVD player  
\- Access to Amazon, Netflix etc  
\- Supports 4K Blu-Ray/DVD  
\- Quite compact and no external PSU  
\- WiFi controller  
\- Easy to navigate menus with plenty of content  
\- Very little or no noise  
\- Ability to connect an external hard drive. Currently a cheaper option than
buying the 1TB or 2TB Xboxes.  
\- My wife is very happy with the lack of clutter behind the tv now that the
DVD, Blu_ray player, Fire stick, Wii and all the PSU's and leads have
virtually gone.  
\- Stands upright for space saving (with appropriate stand, available at a
very reasonable price from Amazon)  
CONS  
\- Games on disc need to be downloaded onto the hard drive (20-30 minutes,
depending on connection speed as the game invariably needs an update)  
\- Some bundled games, in my case Battlefield 1, have to be downloaded online
as there is no disc just a code. In my case this took nearly eight hours to
fully load at an average speed of 22 MB/S (BT Infinity)  
\- 500GB storage. 5-6 games and this is virtually full. (See PROS above re
external drive)  
\- Controller buttons hard to see in low light (Being picky here and I dare
say that once you memorize which button is where it won't be a problem but
back lighting would be good for us not so young as my memory is about as good
as my eyesight!)  
Overall I'm very happy with my Xbox. I do hope they fix the OS issues and I
did take a star away for that, but at the end of the day I think it's a great
console.

I would not say it’s the best console bcz as we all know that project Scorpio
(Xbox one x) is out there which is the most powerfull console ever.  
Let me straight away tell you it’s pros and cons :  
Pros:  
1.Light weighted beautiful hardware packed console which is 40% smaller than
the original Xbox one.  
2\. No more additional power brick is there!!  
3\. We can use it in INDIA directly without using the voltage step down
converter.  
4.specs are a bit less as compare to PS4 slim but games do lags on ps4 slim
but over Xbox one s games runs super smooth with HDR and 4K upscaling.  
5\. Best blue ray 4K player  
6.best controller ever built in the market  
7\. Xbox has many advantages over PS4  
As it deliver better frame rates and graphics even though it is slightly less
powerful than it  
8\. Can use Netflix content in 4K quality directly on this console.  
9.you do not have to charge the controller every 5 minutes as I’m like in PS4
. Batteries can work last upto 1week if used regularly.  
10\. You can play backward compatible games as well.  
11\. I will not provide ratings for looks ,quality or design etc cz the whole
purpose of providing this review is to make u understand briefly regarding
this product.  
Cons:  
1\. Still consoles needed batteries  
2\. No other cons I’ve faced right now  
  
Verdict : if you are buying a console for the first time or switching from
Xbox 360 or PS3 then go for it or else go for project Scorpio or PS4 pro

This is a huge upgrade as it now has HDR, 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray, and 4K
streaming video. It’s actually good-looking. The console looks nice and is a
bit small.  
Pros------------  
  
Smaller than Xbox One  
4K game upscaling  
It's a cheap UHD Blu-ray player  
HDR compatible  
Improved, grippy controller  
Cons-------------  
  
Not native 4K in games  
review imagereview imagereview image

Two months of owning this, and it’s hands down the best entertainment device
I’ve owned!  
  
I’ve always got my consoles from the US as they cost half of what they do here
but I bought this here so I could have DRM-free, region-free peace of mind as
well as tech support if needed. I’m not too particular about playing the
latest game immediately at launch, I’ll play them at some point of time, so
with the combined Xbox Live Gold and Xbox Game Pass subscriptions, I’ll never
have to buy another game again.  
  
Now coming back to the console itself, it can play Blu Ray disks, connect to
your TV and control your tv from your Xbox controller or using the Xbox Remote
app, or even watch Amazon Videos and YouTube. It’s a home entertainment system
and not just a gaming console. I power the system on using the iOS app when I
come home, choose a TV show on Amazon Video and sit back, all without even
switching the Xbox Controller on. It’s that easy! Also some people have asked
me about game downloads in the background. Yes, it downloads games in the
background if Instant Power-on is selected as an option, and plus point is it
switches on in 10 seconds if this option remains enabled. If you’re someone
who games at night, you’ll like the option of connecting your earphones or
headphones to the controller and enjoying your game with the home theater
system turned off. And yes, best coupled with a 5.1 home theatre system and a
40+ inches Full HD TV.  
  
Overall, an excellent buy. Have to mention that the 5 stars is for the
product. For Amazon, I’d rate the buying experience a frustrating 2 stars.
Customer Service was pathetic. And I would have liked it if Amazon had not
delayed the free game codes, I got them nearly 3 weeks and 2 escalations
later.

Used it for a couple of weeks. I'm a pc gamer who Purchased this originally as
a backup system for games and Internet. Went in with super low expectations.
Came out on the other end insanely happy.  
  
Things would look crisp on a 1080p tv despite it having only a 1.4 TF gpu (for
reference a rx 580 is 6 teraflops) this console is great for the price and
what it provides.  
  
For people here trying to decide between XB and PS ecosystems I'll make it
easy for you  
  
1) if playing and experiencing different games is your first priority / and or
if you already have a PC, go the PlayStation route.  
  
2) if you're buying this as a first console or a backup system, don't really
care about letting go of 2-3 sony games like horizon, uncharted or spiderman
etc , it's perfect. Comes with the really feature rich Microsoft ecosystem, 4k
uhd blu-ray playback etc.

Perfect Media and entertainment center for the price I have paid for . Ordered
it from Amazon.com (US)during the holiday season and got it for 12.3k INR . So
if you are considering to buy one just check with any of your friends or
relatives who can get it from US or UAE where we will get it at half price.
Just try out your luck  
  
I am not really into games but was looking for a decent 4k Blu-ray player and
after so much research I thought to order Xbox one s because of the price and
the kind of options that I am getting with it. Picked up the forza bundle and
it will download the game which is 57GB .  
  
The console is sleek , very silent and no heating issues at all during
processing.  
  
So am overall happy with my purchase

review:
Perfect balance between Gaming and Media centre for the price. People rating 1
star are all from pre-order and have not received the game codes for
Microsoft. I have got in touch with Xbox support and got my 2 games ( Gear of
wars 4 and Battlefield 1) the fun part is Microsoft were generous enough to
provide Delux editions. I am extremely happy with the console and the
performance. Dont listen to PS4 fans, just do your research online and decide
for yourself which console suits your needs. You can switch region to US and
install Amazon Video then switch back to India after installation. 4K. UHD HDR
contents on Amazon Video looks fabulous!!!

Just go for it console is amazing. Go for Xbox one x only if u have 4k tv or
if ur 1080p tv size is 48 inches or more otherwise u will not notice much
difference in graphics. I have 32 inch 1080p tv so I got Xbox one s since it
is enough for 1080p tv of less than 48 inches as pixels don't get blurry on
1080p at 32 inch. At 48 inch or more 1080p starts getting blurry due to large
size of display. More the display size higher the resolution it requires to
display crisp image. You need to update the console after booting it for first
time. Update size is 1300mb. I don't have any problem downloading Xbox one
games which ranges btw 40-50gb since I have superfast 40mbps broadband
connection. I will recommend you guys to have minimum 16mbps connection if you
want to buy Xbox one because most of the games need update in order to remove
bugs if any or for multiplayer.  
  
Note: I got 3 free games code in my email after 15 days. U need to order from
cloudtail seller in order to get those 3 free game codes.You will get 1 year
warranty only if u order from cloudtail seller otherwise u won't get any
warranty. To check ur Xbox warranty type Xbox one warranty on Google open the
link and enter serial number of ur console after signing in with ur Xbox id on
Microsoft website. I have 40mbps connection so I have no issue downloading
digital games. Game size ranges btw 35-50gb depending upon the game.

I did not get 2 extra game when will i get them and how will i het it

I purchased Xbox one S before it's India launch as I could not wait for the
delayed release, Microsoft India should be ashamed for 14 months delay in
release.  
Coming to the Console, it's slightly more powerful than the previous Xbox one.
The 4k Blu-ray drive is amazing. It's the best value for money console in
market now. It has no competition. Xbox UI is the best and the smoothest.
Online experience is amazing. Xbox live provides the most social gaming
experience, there's no doubt about that.

It is a nice console. I prefer it because its interface is really nice.But the
games are really much expensive than PS4 . PS4 games are at almost half the
price of xbox one games. So I think that I made a mistake in buying this
instead PS4

I like the product. Its worth the price. I thought of purchasing new games.
But Thanks to Amazon. So far i got Beta Codes for 4 latest Games. Each one in
minimum 40GB :(

When will I receive Forza 6,the crew and the other game only forza 3 is given
still I didn't receive any code

If you have a 4K TV, you should absolutely go for it. At this price,the Xbox
One S beats the PS4 hands down. I havent seen any downside to this product
till now. Be it in gaming or be it in media usage. And the product design is
sleek and awesome as well. I got 4 games along with the product which was a
significant plus point. Connectivity is easy as well. The UI of microsoft is
good as well. And obviously backward compatibility for Xbox 360 games is a
huge pro for this product. If you are ready to spend significantly more than
this product then you should go for the Xbox One X and not PS.

Not getting two free games battlefield 1 and gears of war 4 as promised.

It's the best console but the price in India is way to high.Go to amazon.co.uk
to buy the same product in 16000

review:
If you are not a noob or sony excluses fan then trust me its a good choice. I
was confuse at start but now I am happy to have it..Controllers are best and
they can't be more better. I know we need extra battery but hey they are
enough to play for long duration.. no need to charge controller in between
gameplay..They will last you near about 20 hours..I think that nice as you can
complete your mostly games without changing them.  
I am giving Xbox one s 4 stars.. not 5 because digital games are more
expensive than games cd and cd must be inserted in console if you want to
play, it doesn't matter if you installed the game..

As the company states Xbox one s is one for all.  
Games run flawless with mind-blowing graphics.  
The seller INDIANMART delivered the item on time and the product is absolutely
genuine.  
Go ahead and purchase the console. You'll never complain about anything about
it.  
Xbox one is great and seller INDIANMART is very helpful.

5 stars to the Microsoft Support team that helped me to get the two free
additional games  
3 stars to the seller for quick delivery of the console but unwanted delay in

CSA's needs to be properly trained and should speak truth.. not like : Sir, we
are sorry the last CSA you contacted gave you wrong information..

Go and buy PlayStation instead...!!!
